title: Imports data from Apify dataset into Firebase Firestore collection. Use it to store data collected by other Apify actors to Firebase Firestore.

apiKey.title: API key to Firebase
apiKey.description: Your API key to Firebase. It can be found in Firebase console under Project settings -> General -> Web API key.

authDomain.title: Auth domain to Firebase
authDomain.description: Your auth domain to Firebase. It can be found in Firebase console under Project settings -> Add app -> Web app -> Register app -> Code snippet -> authDomain.

projectId.title: Project ID to Firebase
projectId.description: Your project ID to Firebase. It can be found in Firebase console under Project settings -> General -> Project ID.

firestoreCollectionId.title: Firestore collection ID
firestoreCollectionId.description: Firestore collection ID to import data to. It can be found in Firebase console under Firestore Database -> Data. Ensure that the Firestore permissions are set to allow read and write. If the collection does not exist, it will be created.

datasetId.title: Dataset ID in Apify to import data from
datasetId.description: Dataset ID in Apify to import data from. It can be found in Apify console under Storage -> Datasets -> Dataset ID.

customIdField.title: Custom ID field
customIdField.description: Optional field name to use as a document ID in Firestore. If not provided, the document ID will be generated automatically. It is applied after the transform function. In case of duplicate IDs, the document will be overwritten. Read more in README.

transformFunction.title: Transform function
transformFunction.description: Optional transform function to modify data before import. For more info see README.
